alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Summit; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 3:54PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hawaii in Hawaii County through 500 PM HST... At 354 PM HST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Puuanahulu, or 15 miles north of Kailua-Kona, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kailua-Kona, Waikoloa Village, Honokaa, Paauilo, Waipio Valley, Kukuihaele, Puuanahulu, Kamuela, Laupahoehoe, Ookala, Kalaoa, Waimanu Valley, Puako, Kawaihae, Pohakuloa Training Area, Waikoloa Beach, Waikii, Mauna Lani and Kona International Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM HST for Hawaii.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Summit; Kohala; Kona
